case_vignette: A 45-year-old man with a body mass index of 45 kg/m^2 presents to his primary care doctor with right hip pain. He asserts that the pain is instigated by walking up and down stairs around a construction site which he oversees. On physical exam, his hips are symmetric and equal with no tenderness to palpation bilaterally. His left lower extremity appears grossly normal with full range of motion. His right knee appears symmetric, but the patient whimpers when the anteromedial part of the tibial plateau is pressed. No other parts of his knee are tender. No tenderness is elicited with extension, flexion, varus, and valgus movements of the knee. McMurray's test is negative with both internal and external rotation of the right leg.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've got this pain in my right hip, and it gets worse when I'm walking up and down stairs at work.
Got it. How long have you been experiencing this pain?
I didn't mention when the pain started, just that I have it now.
Do you have any other symptoms other than the pain in your right hip?
Yes, my right knee hurts when a specific part on the inner side of the lower knee is pressed.
Understood. Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your hip or knee?
I didn't mention any injuries or trauma.
I apologize for the oversight. Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications that may be relevant to these symptoms?
I didn't mention any medical conditions or medications.
I see, thank you for your patience. Is there any family history of joint problems or arthritis?
I didn't mention any family history.
Understood. Have you had any imaging done for your hip or knee pain, such as X-rays or MRI?
No, I haven't mentioned having any imaging tests done.

I understand. Based on your symptoms, it is possible that you may be experiencing osteoarthritis in your right hip and knee.

**Final Diagnosis:** Osteoarthritis in right hip and knee
